info.title: sevDesk Order API
info.description:
# General information Welcome to our Order API!
You can use it to manage orders in your sevDesk account. # Cross-Origin Resource Sharing This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).
It enables cross-domain communication from the browser.
All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site. # Embedding resources When retrieving resources by using this API, you might encounter nested resources in the resources you requested.
For example, an invoice always contains a contact, of which you can see the ID and the object name.
This API gives you the possibility to embed these resources completely into the resources you originally requested.
Taking our invoice example, this would mean, that you would not only see the ID and object name of a contact, but rather the complete contact resource. To embed resources, all you need to do is to add the query parameter 'embed' to your GET request.
As values, you can provide the name of the nested resource.
Multiple nested resources are also possible by providing multiple names, separated by a comma.

servers.description: Our main application instance which most of our customers work with
Our swiss application instance, hosted and maintained by smart seven AG

get.description: There are a multitude of parameter which can be used to filter. A few of them are attached but for a complete list please check out this list

parameters.name: orderNumber
parameters.description: Retrieve all orders with this order number

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Retrieve all orders with a date equal or higher

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Retrieve all orders with a date equal or lower

parameters.name: contact[id]
parameters.description: Retrieve all orders with this contact. Must be provided with contact[objectName]

parameters.name: contact[objectName]
parameters.description: Only required if contact[id] was provided. 'Contact' should be used as value.

contact.description: The contact used in the order

orderDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

status.description: Please have a look in our API-Overview to see what the different status codes mean

header.description: Normally consist of prefix plus the order number

headText.description: Certain html tags can be used here to format your text

footText.description: Certain html tags can be used here to format your text

addressName.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressStreet.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressZip.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressCity.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressCountry.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

createUser.description: Will be filled automatically by our system and can't be changed

sevClient.description: Client to which order belongs. Will be filled automatically

origin.description: Object from which the order was created. For example an offer.

objectName.description: Model name of the object. Could be 'Order'.

version.description:
Version of the order.
Can be used if you have multiple drafts for the same order.
Should start with 0

smallSettlement.description:
Defines if the client uses the small settlement scheme.
    If yes, the order must not contain any vat

contactPerson.description: The user who acts as a contact person for the order

taxRate.description: Is overwritten by order position tax rates

taxSet.description: Tax set of the order. Needs to be added if you chose the tax type custom

taxText.description: A common tax text would be 'Umsatzsteuer 19%'

taxType.description:
Tax type of the order.
There are four tax types:
1. default - Umsatzsteuer ausweisen
2. eu - Steuerfreie innergemeinschaftliche Lieferung (Europäische Union)
3. noteu - Steuerschuldnerschaft des Leistungsempfängers (außerhalb EU, z. B. Schweiz)
4. custom - Using custom tax set
Tax rates are heavily connected to the tax type used.

orderType.description: Type of the order. For more information on the different types, check this section of our API-Overview

sendDate.description: The date the order was sent to the customer

address.description:
Complete address of the recipient including name, street, city, zip and country.
Line breaks can be used and will be displayed on the invoice pdf.

currency.description: Currency used in the order. Needs to be currency code according to ISO-4217

sumDiscounts.description: Sum of all discounts in the order

sumNetForeignCurrency.description: Net sum of the order in the foreign currency

sumTaxForeignCurrency.description: Tax sum of the order in the foreign currency

sumGrossForeignCurrency.description: Gross sum of the order in the foreign currency

sumDiscountsForeignCurrency.description: Discounts sum of the order in the foreign currency

customerInternalNote.description: Internal note of the customer. Contains data entered into field 'Referenz/Bestellnummer'

showNet.description: If true, the net amount of each position will be shown on the order. Otherwise gross amount

sendType.description:
Type which was used to send the order. IMPORTANT: Please refer to the order section of the
     *     API-Overview to understand how this attribute can be used before using it!

post.description: Creates an order to which positions can be added later.

requestBody.description:
Creation data. Please be aware, that you need to provide at least all required parameter
    of the order model!

orderDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Id of order resource to delete

409.description: Conflict - f.e occurs if the order is not a draft

get.description: Retrieve all order positions depending on the filters defined in the query.

parameters.name: order[id]
parameters.description: Retrieve all order positions belonging to this order. Must be provided with voucher[objectName]

parameters.name: order[objectName]
parameters.description: Only required if order[id] was provided. 'Order' should be used as value.

update.description: Date of last order position update

order.description: The order to which the position belongs.

part.description: Part from your inventory which is used in the position.

price.description: Price of the article/part. Is either gross or net, depending on the sevDesk account setting.

priceTax.description: Tax on the price of the part

unity.description: The unit in which the positions part is measured

sevClient.description: Client to which order position belongs. Will be filled automatically

positionNumber.description: Position number of your position. Can be used to order multiple positions.

discount.description: An optional discount of the position.

optional.description: Defines if the position is optional.

post.description: Creates an order position for an order.

requestBody.description:
Creation data. Please be aware, that you need to provide at least all required parameter
    of the order position model!
